issue.title: Feature request: environment variables

repository.name: rclone-exporter
repository.description: A prometheus metrics exporter for Rclone

issue.body:
Would be great to have support for environment vars, at least for basic auth credentials.  In orchestrators like kubernes is practical to use env vars.
Thanks

body:
Interesting idea :-)

>  It would be nice if we can alter the query (e.g. ?format=prometheus) so that it would provide the metrics in OpenMetrics/Prometheus format.

Do you have a link for those specs?

> That probably should also become a GET request instead of POST. Or another solution altogether.

Probably a read only GET request would be a good idea for stats.

Are you interested in working on this for rclone?

> Do you have a link for those specs?

You can find it here: https://prometheus.io/docs/instrumenting/exposition_formats/

You do not need to write the metrics "by hand" in order to comply with the specs, there are libraries for that, e.g https://github.com/prometheus/client_golang
. With this, you basically set the values of some counter regularly, and when a client accesses the metrics endpoint (`/metrics` is the Prometheus convention), the handler will print everything nicely. Ofc, this can be customized and integrated in other webserver libraries.

> Probably a read only GET request would be a good idea for stats.

Thats what the Prometheus client does out of the box. However, it might be desired to put it also behind auth if enabled, as some users might argue that it exposes possibly sensitive data.

> Are you interested in working on this for rclone?

Sadly I'm not sure I find the time to do that in the near future.

my 2ct: Please consider using Go's expvars which "provides a standardized interface to public variables" https://golang.org/pkg/expvar/
I believe Prometheus supports those natively, too.

Hm, I'm not sure about that. The fact that there's something like https://github.com/albertito/prometheus-expvar-exporter does not give an impression that prometheus supports that natively. Although there is a "transformer" inside the prometheus client that does similar: https://github.com/prometheus/client_golang/blob/master/prometheus/expvar_collector.go. Might as well integrate prometheus client directly.

I'd prefer something that is more user friendly (i.e. Prometheus can be used natively without an additional exporter in between) and also that is language-independent. Go's expvar format is really just used in Go and not standardized across languages.

Unless expvar is already being used by rclone, then the expvar_collector just needs to be activated I guess.

I had a go with the https://github.com/prometheus/client_golang - it looks like that exports quite a lot of useful stats by default such as memory, http performance etc so it would probably be worth building on top of that.

Reading the docs I think rclone would have to implement a custom metrics `Collector` which reads the stats from the stats block (with the appropriate locking).

Is this the right approach do you think?

Does anyone want to take it up and make a PR from it?
I'll see if I can find some time to take a look.

issue.title: rcd: Add Prometheus metrics support

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Add Prometheus metrics support for rcd.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Resolves #3858

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Nice! Thank you for looking into this.
Can you post an example output?

Looking good so far.

I have used rclone primarily in batch mode so far (so, cronjob where we sync from source to target and exit).
In cases where multi-job usage is running, it might make sense to use labels to differentiate between the jobs. Lines could be looking like this:
```
rclone_bytes_transferred_total{source="source-bucket",target="target-bucket"} 1546
```
Not sure if that's a use case?
